result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (3rd) and Operating w/ PAC (3rd). The defendant was found guilty of OWI (3rd) and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (3rd) was dismissed by the court.

  • Teresa A Keppert was found guilty of OWI (3rd), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Defendant to attend Victim Impact Panel

miscConds.notes: Defendant to make payments on fine/costs to the Clerk of Court's office after her release from jail but during the probation period. Payments on fine may be extended after the probation period, if necessary. Failure to pay may result in a civil judgment.
Defendant is granted privileges set forth in Wis Stats 303.08

-Absolute sobriety.
-No controlled substances or prescription medication unless prescribed by physician and in conformity with said prescription.
-Random tests.
-Counseling/treatment as deemed appropriate.
-Defendant to submit a DNA sample.
-Pay supervision fees.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Teresa A Keppert in court with attorney Rachel Marie Alme-Boaz.  Adam Yale Gerol appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant enters no contest plea to Ct. 1. Court examines defendant, finds her guilty and renders sentence. Count 2 dismissed.

Attorney Rachel Marie Alme-Boaz in court.  Shannon M. Whitworth appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant not appearing in court.  Counsel advises the court of the defendants situation.  Counsel requests adjournment for plea and sentencing.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for June 1, 2016 at 02:00 pm.
Defendant called and spoke with clerk in regards to today's hearing, she will be unable to attend due to a family situation.
Plea/sentencing hearing on May 17, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Teresa A Keppert in court with attorney Rachel Marie Alme-Boaz.  Shannon M. Whitworth appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court is informed the SCRAM bracelet has been removed, defendant cannot afford it and she does not have a ride for PBT tests. Court schedules plea/sentencing next week.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for May 17, 2016 at 08:30 am.
Hearing on May 9, 2016 at 11:30 am.
SCRAM Report Non-Compliant.  Copies sent to DA and Atty Alme Boaz.
Plea/sentencing hearing on May 31, 2016 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Teresa A Keppert in court with attorney Rachel Marie Alme-Boaz.  Jeffrey A Sisley appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court is informed defendant is attempting to complete AODA assessment and find employment before disposition. Bail to continue.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for May 31, 2016 at 10:00 am on all cases, traffic cases tracking with criminal.

w/conditions:  absolute sobriety; SCRAM bracelet within 24 hours.

Defendant Teresa A Keppert in court with attorney Rachel Marie Alme-Boaz.  Jeffrey A Sisley appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant advised of complaint/penalties thereof. Defendant enters not guilty plea on 16CM78. Atty. Alme Boaz states defendant cannot comply with bail conditions, requests bail be revoked. Court revokes bail, remands defendant to custody of the Sheriff's Dept.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for April 13, 2016 at 10:00 am.
w/condition: previously ordered conditions with addition, defendant to submit daily PBT at 9:00 pm at Ozaukee County Sheriff's Dept, SCRAM removed effective today.
